result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven John Nolan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven John Nolan in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Steven John Nolan.  Prosecuting attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that defendant now wishes to obtain private counsel. Defense further requests case be adjourned for a status conference date. Court grants request and informs defendant, that shall he obtain new representation counsel must be present for the next hearing. Case adjourned to Br 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-06-2022

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Steven John Nolan in court with Attorney Jason A Findling; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior OWI convictions. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer - H. Almas.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 07-26-2022

Defendant Steven John Nolan in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests this matter be set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Defendant is reminded to continue working with Justice Point. Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.   Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.   No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Steven John Nolan in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Steven John Nolan in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven John Nolan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
